alert.note: Alert for Northern Erie; Southern Erie; Wyoming (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 10:15PM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Wyoming and northeastern Erie Counties through 1100 PM EDT... At 1014 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Williamsville, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Buffalo, Cheektowaga, West Seneca, Kenmore, Depew, Amherst, Tonawanda, Lancaster, East Aurora, Williamsville, Elma, Marilla, Bennington, Alden, Wales Center, Elma Center, Billington Heights, Cowlesville and South Wales. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 49 and 53. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
